_header: Lordings and ye will lith / Of o thing I shall you kith
Note: See also 3244; and for the earlier version of which this is an abridgement see 6871.

BodDou302.First Lines:
Lordis ȝif ȝe wil lyþeOf aþing I wil ȝou
                    kyþe…
BodDou302.Last Lines:
…Ihesu saue ȝou from te fynd& bryng ȝour soule
                    to blis
BodDou302.Attributed Title:
De meritis misse quomodo debemus audire missam (f. 10v);
                        Explicit meritis misse (f. 12rb)
BodDou302.Editions:
Halliwell-Phillipps,  James Orchard. 
             The Poems of John Audelay.
Percy Society
         14. London: Richards, 1844: 66-81.
Whiting,  Ella Keats,
                        ed.  
             John Audelay: The Poems.
EETS
         o.s. 184 (1931); repr. 1988: 65-79.

BLHar3954.First Lines: LOrdyngis & ȝe wyl lytheOf o thyng I xal kythe…
BLHar3954.Last Lines: …With þe to wonyn in heuene blysseGod þat boutyst vs dereAmen Amen Amen
BLHar3954.Note: Preceded by rubric note: Hic testatur quantum habebis in audiencia misse. Scriptum est omnis semitas per viam quas tu facis veniendo ad ecclesiam ad angelis dei coram omnipotenti deo in regno celorum manifestabuntur (f. 74rb).
